title: Inting/AFKing should be worse than typing
body:
Now, I'm not exactly the nicest player all the time. Sometimes when people grief me or type shit to me I can't control myself and type back. And that is 100% deserved. I get that. But, how in the hell is typing so much more punishable than griefing? It makes no sense to me. You can just mute me and my typing, but I can't mute you and ruining my game. The same goes to AFKing. If you go 0/3 and then AFK, that's not lag, that is ragequitting. And you should be punished. Or if you specifically type something saying you are not trying, going to AFK, etc., then that should be a RED FLAG AND SHOULD BE PUNISHED. But no. If I flame a griefer, I am 100 times more likely to get punished than they are. And obviously flaming is bad. I'm not playing the victim here. But it needs to be looked further into, these things. People literally just admit they aren't trying and it does not matter. Almost always, nothing happens to them.

Edit: I also want to add that everybody knows that this is how it works. If you ever ask a streamer, they will 100% agree with you if you said that if you don't type, you can do anything you want and not get banned. This is a widely known thing that people abuse and it's ridiculous.

replies.body:
INT = to running it down mid

not having a bad game there is a big difference but people seem to think they are one in the same
People use the term int even if you miss cs or your ult. They really need to learn the true meaning of it lol
I'm not referring to that. Obviously people get mad at throw the term around. But I am talking about genuinely malicious actions.

But you can’t confirm. Sure, it may look like rage quitting. But let me tell you a story - last night, my friend was playing panth into a Camille top lane, and I was support. He was getting weird FPS spikes and ended up 0/4 in lane around 12 minutes. He then got a bugsplat and couldn’t reconnect to the game at all even though he kept trying until it ended.

Yes, I know this is the fact because I was sitting right next to him (well, same room different desk) playing on my laptop while he was on his desktop. But you’re saying the fact he dc after going 0/4 instantly means he deserves a severe punishment for rage quitting?

Point being is that very rarely is this so cut and dry. Sure, in many cases someone disconnecting after going 0/4 is going to be a rage quit.... but how do you confirm that and avoid punishing innocent players like my friend?

Players who ragequit multiple games and show a pattern of it that proves beyond reasonable doubt that they are intentionally AFKing do get punished. Unfortunately, those that come to the boards tend to delete their own threads when they see the community isn’t stupid and can clearly see the behavior in their match history.

I'm not deleting my post. I stand by everything I've said. If I get downvoted then I don't care. I try to be a reasonable person and I try to have reasonable discussions with people. I'm not a radical person. Something that is a big issue with what I'm saying is that Riot doesn't have the time to check every report thoroughly, which really sucks. I guess I initially posted this as a sort of rant, despite being true in what I say. Perhaps there's just no fix to it, just simply because of the size of the game.

To be quite frank with you, this reply is full of "hot air" or "BS" (take your pick).

You are not being reasonable here. You admit yourself that you're ranting. You admit that perhaps there's "no fix" - yet your entire post has been a rant.

I encourage you to use the rant board if you're unwilling to have actual discussion.

I am having actual discussion. People have replied to me, I've replied back. I give my reasoning, give examples that have happened to me. I initially made this out of frustration of being griefed in a game, which was one of many recently. So in that way it was a "rant". But I still genuinely believe I am making a decent argument and trying to have reasonable discussions. It's not like I'm saying "oh no you're wrong" then give no reason. Anything that I say should happen, when I looked back at it, and seeing everyone else's reply, may just be unrealistic, similar to how the tribunal is unrealistic. That was an afterthought. I don't really see where you're coming from when you say that I'm unwilling to have a discussion. 

Apart from that, I do realize that I actually forgot to type my response to you and saying how to confirm cases like your friend. I thought I did. What I meant to say was that the key to finding that is in the chat logs. A lot of people you can really tell by them either flat out saying they don't want to play, ff votes, negativity in general, etc. Which goes back to saying it's "unrealistic", thinking back on it, that Riot actually has time to go through those reports.

Being able to "really tell" does not mean being able to prove. People who flat out admit to ragequitting in chat are punished. It doesn't matter what they say unless they're admitting to it - because you thinking you can "really tell" doesn't make it proof.

Riot does review reports (be they ticket or comment in the end game screen) about people admitting to ragequitting and punish those players when there is proof beyond reasonable doubt (i.e. an admission).

that's just about every term in league lol
feeder
hardstuck
inter
trash
etc

blame pro scene which goes "im inting" if they make a fail play even tho they know they wont die/didnt die.
and stupid fanboys that are too young/stupid to use their own brain think thats what inting is. making a bad play.

Of course. But, inting is still not trying. I understand bad games. I am not one to quickly say someone is genuinely trolling. And I don't report it. But let me give you an example. My Soraka told my Vayne she's gonna start taking CS because she wasn't playing aggressive. She proceeded to NEVER HEAL THE VAYNE and NEVER HELP HER. She literally SAID she was not helping Vayne. Why is that okay? That should be instantly 14 day banned. She admitted to not helping people because she simply didn't like the way they played.

Obviously bad games happen but these are not 'bad games'. And I think that inting not only covers actually running it down, but literally not trying to win. It's ranked. You queue up for ranked, you are saying you are going to try.

that isnt INTING 

that is trolling/ grief
Okay. The point stands. They should be given the same punishment. They're both actively trying to lose the game. The different shouldn't matter.
If it's a ranked game, it is the same thing.
no it isnt.

If I overextend in my lane, while the river is not warded, and the enemy jungler is not on the map, and I die to gank, that is an Int.

In a ranked game a player is expected to have basic knowledge of the game and be in a good enough mental state to use that knowledge.

OK, OK, so let me get this straight.

You never, ever, EVER make bad or questionable decisions in a League game. EVER? And if you did, you'd be OK with getting banned?

I'm sorry, that's not how a ranking system works. Those who consistently make poor decisions will end up in lower ranks, those who do not will climb.

This is the age old thing where someone (you) is blaming everyone and their mothers because they can't climb. God forbid you change how you're playing, what lanes you're playing, what champions you choose, new builds, etc.

In order for NA to stop being a for fun region we need to set standards. Playing like hashinshin and poking your enemy under tower when there is an obvious timing to be ganked and you don't have wards is not acceptable, and neither is being a permapushing yasuo and going 1/10 then complaining about being camped when you shove under tower 24/7. 

Also I can't climb? You've been the same rank since season six bud.

> In order for NA to stop being a for fun region we need to set standards.

This is a video game. You don't get to dictate how people play. Take it as seriously as you want, but as long as people are playing within the rules and trying to win, how they have fun is up to them.

> You've been the same rank since season six bud.

I choose not to try because ranked aggravates the living fuck out of me and it's not worth it. Early seasons I'd do hundreds-thousands of games per season for nothing. Now I get get the Gold rewards in around 30 matches and not have to deal with as many ragebabies and tryhards.

Enjoy your climb!

>This is a video game. You don't get to dictate how people play. Take it as seriously as you want, but as long as people are playing within the rules and trying to win, how they have fun is up to them.

This is competitive ranked, you WILL play the game properly.

Players like you are the reason NA is made fun of.

> This is competitive ranked, you WILL play the game properly.

Your attitude is unfortunately going to get you banned one of these days.

no the PRO SCENE is COMPETITIVE 

solo queue isnt

it isnt played on a LAN with all the same monitors/pcs where every one has exactly the same set ups.

And players like you are the people that I really DIDN'T want on my side. This is the complete opposite of the point I am trying to make. If you have bad games, whatever. The problem is when you are actively communicating to your team that you are not trying. You can't just ban people for playing badly, and is completely missing the point I tried to make. You shouldn't be banned for overextending in a lane, that is not an "int". Tunnel vision exists. It happens to everyone.

> [{quoted}](name=ProphetOfDraven,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eETOEBLL,comment-id=000000020000000000010000,timestamp=2019-12-28T23:29:42.219+0000)
>
> In order for NA to stop being a for fun region we need to set standards. Playing like hashinshin and poking your enemy under tower when there is an obvious timing to be ganked and you don't have wards is not acceptable, and neither is being a permapushing yasuo and going 1/10 then complaining about being camped when you shove under tower 24/7. 

You're not banned in any other region just for playing poorly.

so you should of been banned for INTing a long time ago then? 

INT is intentional as in fuk my team and this game im going to lose on purpose not a mental lapse where you over extended and just so happen to do so the same time the jungler is there. 

or when you legit get 3 man dove under turret or anything of that nature. that isnt dying on purpose to throw a game.
I mean maybe gold 4 and below dying to a gank you shouldn't have is fine but above that elo you are expected to know how to play the game.

then if that was inting and you get banned for inting then league would have zero players 


seriously
Zero bad players*
that's because the people that int just say "oh bad game guys, sorry" as sorry ass excuse to cover their bullshit

im not saying people dont do that but that is rare. 

but having a bad kda/ getting camped/ bad match ups isnt the same as inting

Inting/Griefing is punished worse. Gameplay offenses start with a 14 day ban. The only time a verbal starts there is when someone uses zero tolerance.

Verbal is punished MORE often because it is easier to detect.

We could use something to help identify malicious AFK, but I understand that isn't easy.

It is punished worse, but FAR less frequently. That is the entire point of what I am trying to say. I played on a smurf account, around 70 games right now. At least 8 of those I would say I have gotten griefed or AFK'd on after the game starts, and not just DC's mind you. Yet I can guarentee you none of them get punished. Riot should check chat logs when things like this happpen, ESPECIALLY AFK'S. Because if I AFK 5 times in a row, what do I get? A queue timer? Who cares??? There is no way that should be happening when running it down is just as bad but gives you perma's.

And I agree the system for detecting gameplay offenses and malicious afk need improvements. I also understand that it isn't that easy in the long haul.

Your suggestion of using the chat? Now people will commit the problems quietly. Meaning back to square one. The community can't wholly agree on what is and isn't trolling. Afks happen because life happens and proving intent for afk isn't simple. "Use chat" So lie in chat before maliciously afking, got it.

And in the cases that they don't lie, that they are less caring, that they flat out admit they don't want to play, it should be punished. Which right now, it almost always isn't. Obviously you can't prove all AFK's. But there are definitely some cases that CAN be and doesn't matter.

This is 100% accurate. I frequently leave games because I get so angry with this game that my head hurts and I need to take a break. Honestly I was gonna quit playing this game once my main account got banned but that hasn't happened yet. I've even left games early on and it still doesn't count as a leave. I still get experience, mastery, etc. It baffles me how awful this system is. I'm literally TRYING TO GET PUNISHED and I can't. I mean sure, I could just use some racial slurs to get banned, but I'm not that type of person.

> [{quoted}](name=Toxicate13,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eETOEBLL,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-12-28T21:18:26.331+0000)
>
> This is 100% accurate. I frequently leave games because I get so angry with this game that my head hurts and I need to take a break. Honestly I was gonna quit playing this game once my main account got banned but that hasn't happened yet. I've even left games early on and it still doesn't count as a leave. I still get experience, mastery, etc. It baffles me how awful this system is. I'm literally TRYING TO GET PUNISHED and I can't. I mean sure, I could just use some racial slurs to get banned, but I'm not that type of person.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/IoE9GlKT-just-uninstalled-league-of-legends

If uninstalling isn't enough to get you to quit, then you need to seriously reflect and improve on your self-control.

> [{quoted}](name=AeroWaffle,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eETOEBLL,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-12-28T22:19:08.252+0000)
>
> https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/IoE9GlKT-just-uninstalled-league-of-legends
> 
> If uninstalling isn't enough to get you to quit, then you need to seriously reflect and improve on your self-control.

You should probably reflect on yourself if you get fun out of harassing people on a fucking video game forum

> [{quoted}](name=Toxicate13,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eETOEBLL,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2019-12-29T02:19:39.455+0000)
>
> You should probably reflect on yourself if you get fun out of harassing people on a fucking video game forum

I don't find this fun nor is it harassing. I just hope that some fraction of the people I talk to either have some self-reflection for the benefit of the community or at least the betterment of themselves.

You come to the boards to complain about the state of the game, what the rules are, and the enforcement of the rules. You admit to breaking the rules intentionally and act like you're actively trying to get punished (while admitting to avoiding certain types of rule breaking that will likely get you caught and banned).

You willingly make each and every decision to continue playing the game yet also want to act like you want to stop playing (be it through getting banned or through uninstalling).

If you want to stop playing... stop playing. But just because you're unwilling to actually quit the game does it mean that you're absolved of intentionally trying to ruin the games for others. Don't try to shift the blame for intentionally leaving games.

I don't like real-life analogies, but this is the best I can think of.

There are more citations for running red lights than there are convictions for murder because the running of red lights **happens way more frequently**.

However, when murder convictions DO happen, the punishments are more severe.

As Imperial Pandaa said, punishments for intentional feeding (or other griefing), when **that's what actually happened and it is detected** start at a 14-day suspension.

Yes, but there has to be a better way to detect it. I just got griefed in one of my games. I reported it. That person admitted to trolling in chat logs. I got that person next game, but on the enemy. She AFK'd after the game went badly. They reported her. I will check that account for the next 3 days, but I can guarentee you that nothing will happen to her. Of course it's much easier to prove typing. But please for the love of god can we actually get some punishment on these people.

Unfortunately due to the massive backlog of reports for behavior like this that are false reports, and given that it’s a holiday time right now, it’s highly likely that it will take more than 3 days for a manual review to be conducted.
Yeah. I try to keep that in mind. I will continually check on these people, but sadly I think I already know what the outcome will be.

>Now, I'm not exactly the nicest player all the time. Sometimes when people grief me or type shit to me I can't control myself and type back. And that is 100% deserved. I get that. But, how in the hell is typing so much more punishable than griefing? It makes no sense to me. (cont.)

 Because one is readily identifiable and the other is not always as apparent.

 Someone can go 0/16 and be _genuinely_ underperforming on purpose, but won't get picked up by the system because they're hiding it well.

 The IFS is definitely not perfect, nobody has ever claimed as much. But eventually, everyone will get caught at one point or another and the _majority_ of egregious cases are handled quickly. 

 Chat punishments are more common because it's (usually) as simple as "Did this person say _x_, _y_, _z_, or act in this manner?" There aren't as many variables as gameplay punishments. 

>You can just mute me and my typing, but I can't mute you and ruining my game.

 Riot themselves have stated multiple times that a mute button is not an excuse to break the rules. We're on their platform, just because someone else can ignore what you're saying doesn't mean you're not saying it. 


>Edit: I also want to add that everybody knows that this is how it works. If you ever ask a streamer, they will 100% agree with you if you said that if you don't type, you can do anything you want and not get banned. This is a widely known thing that people abuse and it's ridiculous.

 This is 100% false.

 [**Here's an example of it being false.**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/EKmk78Ua-i-got-banned-14days-by-int-fed-no-i-didnt-int)

 Here's [**another.**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/Wb6xkgzF-what-for-14-day-ban)

 Here, have [**one more.**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/EAUw5wRZ-14-day-suspension)

 This [**too.**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/lMkc6TTp-i-shouldnt-of-been-banned-its-my-junglar-fault)

1. I got a chat restrict for 2 games of flaming. Fine. I don't care. I flamed 2 people who intentionally griefed me. They sold items to buy other things (this is high diamond, it is not an accident.) They specifically say that they do not care anymore and they are not trying. They are still playing the game days later- and I will give it more time. Obviously there will be time between the incidents and punishment. That is fair. But I am almost sure that it won't happen, despite them chatting that they are not trying.

2. I'm not saying that just because they can mute me it's an "excuse" on why I shouldn't be punished. I'm saying that it shouldn't be the same level of punishment. I'm perfectly aware that it isn't, but with the entire theme of this post, I am suggesting that chatting is punished worse due to the frequency. Obviously griefers are punished worse in obvious cases, but again, far less frequently. I am not using the mute button as an excuse to say why I shouldn't be punished. I obviously should. I'm simply saying that you can't avoid someone trolling, while you can someone flaming. Don't twist my words.

3. I looked at every NA account you linked me- they were all gold. Not to knock them, but they are simply less knowledgeable about the game. I said ask any "streamer", which if you didn't know, most popular streamers are at least high diamond. I probably should've outright said it, but most high elo players are completely aware of what I said. 3 gold players are not equivalent. Again, not to knock them or you, because I didn't say it outright, but high elo knows about this as a whole. It's the same thing with wintraders, which was a MASSIVE problem at the end of the season for people trying to get challenger in the last few days, or whatever you wanted. As long as you don't type nothing will happen. This would not be experienced in the elo that these players you linked me are in.

Edit: For the last one, I also looked at the EUW player who literally ran it down- that is not what I'm talking about. Not everything is that obvious. I am talking about soft inting. Not running it down. Obviously people know that if you literally run it down with the trademark "inting" (Ghost cleanse nunu with mobis) then you are going to get banned.
It won’t ever be because riot just wants to create a toxic community

I played 3 games yesterday on this account, lost 2 because both had an afk, the cati and tris, I think leaving the game without a legitimate reason "like internet problems or lights go out or pc failure" should get a ban, especially if repeated many times
